name: Subterfuze
description:
Get ready for the ultimate puzzle challenge with "Subterfuze"! This exciting game tests your color, font, and shade recognition skills in two thrilling game modes: Normal and Set-To-Fuse.

In Normal mode, you must match two tiles with the same color and number as fast as you can in 60 seconds. But you can also switch to Set mode where you must find a set of three tiles with the same or different color, font style, and shading for a change of larger points. To help you along the way, there are three power-ups available: 2x score multiplier, slow down time, and faster tile regeneration.

But for hardcore players, Set-To-Fuse mode provides an even greater challenge. In this mode, you need to find a set of three tiles first to enter Fuse mode within a limited time of 15 seconds. After 15 seconds, it will return to Set mode where you need to find another set again to enter Fuse mode. Once in Fuse mode, you must match and fuse as many tiles as possible within 120 seconds. It's a race against the clock, and only the most skilled players will succeed.

With its addictive gameplay and challenging puzzles, "Subterfuze" is a game that will keep you entertained for hours on end. Can you beat your high scores and become the ultimate "Subterfuze" champion? Find out now!

Controls
In "Subterfuze", you can control the 4x4 grid of tiles using either the mouse or the keyboard.

To use the mouse, simply click on the tile you want to select. 

Alternatively, you can use the keyboard to control the tiles. The first set of keys you can use are:

  • The keys 1, 2, 3, and 4 correspond to the first row of the board.
  • The keys Q, W, E, and R correspond to the second row.
  • The keys A, S, D, and F correspond to the third row.
  • The keys Z, X, C, and V correspond to the fourth row

For the second set of keys, you can use the following:

  • The keys 7, 8, 9, and 0 correspond to the first row of the board.
  • The keys U, I, O, and P correspond to the second row.
  • The keys J, K, L, and ; correspond to the third row.
  • The keys M, ,, ., and / correspond to the fourth row.

You can also you the SHIFT and the SPACEBAR keys to switch modes.

With these controls, you can quickly pick tiles around the board and find the perfect matches, whether you prefer using the mouse or the keyboard.
